intro: Galarhoeus lucorum f. glabratus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved form of the common thistle, is a botanical variant characterized by its reduced foliage. This plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is native to certain regions of Europe. It exhibits a compact growth habit with spiny stems and is typically found in grassy or disturbed habitats. The leaves are generally smaller and smoother compared to the typical form, making it distinguishable in botanical studies. Its flowering period occurs in late summer, producing yellow flowers that attract pollinators.
